Package fr.utt.lo02.projet.controller

Class ShapeUpGameController

java.lang.Object
fr.utt.lo02.projet.controller.ShapeUpGameController
All Implemented Interfaces:
GameController
Direct Known Subclasses:
AdvancedShapeUpGameController
public class ShapeUpGameController
extends java.lang.Object
implements GameController
This class represent a game controller in the shape up game It is intended to work with 2 views (more precisely a console and a hmi one) and implements therefore a lock system which allow to play using both view in a concurrent way. The controller is here a state-machine, that changes the state of the model (here the AbstractShapeUpGame) the views are observing (Observer pattern) the model and thus are notified when the model changes its states they then call controller method and so on.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    protected boolean endRoundLock
    A lock used in the endRound method, allowing only one view (in the 2) to use this method
    protected boolean endTurnLock
    A lock used in the endTurn method, allowing only one view (in the 2) to use this method
    protected AbstractShapeUpGame gameModel
    the model used in the current game
    protected GameState lastAction
    The last action, here used to make some decision based on previous and current state
    protected boolean playLock
    A lock used in the play method, allowing only one view (in the 2) to use this method
    protected java.util.Set<GameView> view
    The views of the MVC pattern

    • reset

      protected void reset()
      This method handle the console view interruption: To put it shortly when the user can do an action (place,move) he has the choice to do it in console or in hmi. If he does the choice to do it in hmi, the controller needs to stop the console from reading input in the terminal. To do this, we interrupt the reading thread.
      See Also:
      for explanation on how the console handle the interruption
